name: Norweigan Wood
author: Haruki Murakami
review: One of my all time favorite books. Outside of his normal style, but still really hauntingly beautiful in the way all his books are.

name: Bel Canto
author: Anne Patchett
review: Much faster than a lot of her other books. Takes just long enough to get to the end that you forget the original problem. Could be a musical.

name: Little Fires Everywhere
author: Celeste Ng
review: Holy cow, read this in a day. Really makes you think about what's behind these "planned neighborhoods"

name: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
review: Another top all time book. Short read, couple hours, but so much beautiful meaning packed in to a relatively light story.
